content.question: Cohort Population Percent Under 5 years 9,412 3.9% 5 to 9 years 10,427 4.4% 10 to 14 years 11,997 5.0% 15 to 19 years 10,741 4.5% 20 to 24 years 12,282 5.1% 25 to 34 years 30,724 12.8% 35 to 44 years 27,805 11.6% 45 to 54 years 34,701 14.5% 55 to 59 years 18,886 7.9% 60 to 64 years 17,251 7.2% 65 to 74 years 31,112 13.0% 75 to 84 years 16,893 7.1% 85 years and over 7,088 3.0% The census data shown would most likely be used by city government officials to analyze which of the following processes?

choices.label: How income indicates the effects of gentrification in city neighborhoods
How immigration impacts ethnic neighborhoods and cultural institutions
How public services are allocated to the city's demographic groups
How family size indicates the needs of different community organizations
How schools will expand staff and facilities to meet future needs

content.answer: How public services are allocated to the city's demographic groups

unit.text: 6: Cities and Urban Land-Use Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Explain what maps or data imply or illustrate about geographic principles, processes, and outcomes.
